src_text: Merero ya ga Jaana1.
trg_text: Cabinet decisions1.

src_text: Khonferense ya Peeletso ya Aforika Borwa (SAIC) ya Bone
trg_text: Fourth South Africa Investment Conference (SAIC)

src_text: Kabinete e amogetse go konosediwa ka katlego ga SAIC ya bone e e neng e tshwaretswe kwa Tikwatikweng ya Dikhonferense ya Sandton ka Labone, 24 Mopitlwe 2022, e mo go yona babeeletsi ba ka fa nageng le ba bodit haba ba neng ba dira ditsholofetso tse dint hwa tsa go beeletsa mo nageng ya ron
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the successful conclusion of the fourth SAIC held at the Sandton Convention Centre, Johannesburg on Thursday, 24 March 2022, which saw domestic and international investors pledging new investments in our countr

src_text: Go dirilwe ditsholofetso tse dint hwa di le 80 tsa go beeletsa ka fa nageng ya rona tse di ka dirang palogotlhe ya diranta di le dibilione di le 332.
trg_text: Our country received 80 new investment pledges totalling R332 billio This takes the total investments pledged to R trillion, which not only represents 95 percent of our investment target but also places us firmly on the path to exceed our Rtrillion investment target over five year

src_text: Seno se raya gore palo yotlhe ya ditsholofetso fa e kopanngwa e dira ditirilione tsa diranta di le , mme yona ga e supe fela gore re fitlheletse diperesente di le 95 tsa palogotlhe ya ditsholofetso tsa dipeeletso tse re di solofetseng, mme e re baya sentle gore re kgone go feta le palogotlhe ya matlole a re neng re ipeetse ona go a bokeletsa ka dipeeletso a ditirilione tsa diranta di le mo dingwageng di le tlhan
trg_text: So far, R316 billion of the commitments have been invested in 46 projects that have been completed and a further 57 projects that are still under constructio Cabinet notes the successes of past pledges as reported at the Conference, covering among others new production capacityin sectors as diverse as automobiles, food production, pharmaceuticals and digital centre

src_text: Ditsholofetso tseno tsa dipeeletso di tlhomamisa maemo a naga ya rona jaaka lefelo la dipeeletso le le gaisan
trg_text: These investment commitments affirm our country s status as an investment destination of choic

src_text: Go fitlha ga jaana, tse dingwe tsa dipeeletso tsa diranta di le dibilione di le 316 go tswa mo ditsholofetsong tseno di beeleditswe mo diporojekeng di le 46 tse di setseng di konoseditswe le mo diporojekeng di le 57 tse di santseng di dirw Kabinete e nopotse ditsholofetso tsa mo malobeng tse di diragaditsweng jaaka go builwe ka tsona kwa khonferenseng, mme mo bontsintsing jwa tsona go builwe ka makala a tlhagiso ya dikuno a mant hwa, ka go farologana ga ona a a jaaka a dijanaga, a tlhagiso ya dijo, a melemo le a ditikwatikwe tsa dijithal
trg_text: Cabinet approved the intervention in terms of Section 139(7) of the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996, read together with Section 150 of the Municipal Finance Management Act, 2003 (Act 56 of 2003), in the Mangaung Metropolitan and Enoch Mgijima Local municipalitie Both municipalities have been experiencing significant financial and service delivery failures for a prolonged perio

src_text: Kabinete e ikuela mo makaleng otlhe mo set habeng go ema nokeng dikgato tse di botlhokwa tseno tsa go rarabolola matsapa a re nang le ona ka go dirisana mmogo go dirolola seelo sa rona sa botlhokatiro, se se tlhatlogetseng go diperesente di le 3 go ya ka dipoelo tsa go sa le gale tsa Dipatlisiso tsa Dipalopalo tsa Badiri tsa Kgeditharo e Nngwe le e Nngwe (QLFS) tse di rebotsweng ke Setheo sa Dipalopalo sa Aforika Borwa (Stats SA).
trg_text: Cabinet called on all sectors of society to support these critical interventions as we work together to reverse our unemployment rate, which climbed to 3percent, according to the Quarterly Labour Force Survey results released recently by Statistics South Afric 2.

src_text: Go Khutlisiwa ga Maemo a Boset haba a Matlhotlhapelo
trg_text: Lifting of the National State of Disaster

src_text: Kabinete e amogetse gape le dikgato tsa go khutlisiwa ga Maemo a Boset haba a Matlhotlhapelo tse di begilweng ke Moporesitente Cyril Ramaphosa ka Mosupologo, 4 Moranang 2022.
trg_text: Cabinet also welcomed the lifting of the National State of Disaster announced by President Cyril Ramaphosa on Monday, 4 April 2022.

src_text: Re kgonne go fitlhelela kgato eno ka ntlha ya emonokeng ya maAforika Borwa a a neng a ikobela melawanataolo yotlhe ya go itlhokomela mo Bolwetseng jwa Mogare wa Corona (COVID-19) e e neng ya dirwa ke puso go boloka matshelo le boleng ba botshel
trg_text: This milestone was made possible by the resilience of people in South African who complied with all Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) safety protocols designed by government to save lives and livelihood

src_text: Leroborobo le le tla tswelela go laolwa go ya ka Molao wa Boset haba wa Boitekanelo, 2003 (Molao 61 wa 2003).
trg_text: The pandemic will henceforth be managed in terms of the National Health Act, 2003 (Act 61 of 2003).

src_text: Seralwa sa melawana ya boitekanelo e e tla tsenyang tirisong Molao wa Boset haba wa Boitekanelo wa 2003 se buletswe ditshwaelo tsa baagi go fitlha ka 16 Moranang 2022.
trg_text: The draft health regulations that will inform the National Health Act of 2003 are open for public comment until 16 April 2022.

src_text: Kabinete e gakolotse batho botlhe mo nageng go tswelela go dirisa mekgwathibelo e e maleba go itshireletsa mmogo le ba bangwe kgatlhanong le ditshwaetso tsa COVID-19.
trg_text: Cabinet called on all South Africans to work together as we continue our struggle to overcome the impact of COVID-19.

src_text: Yona e akaretsa go tswelela go tlhapa diatla ka sesepa kgotsa go dirisa sanithaesa e e nang le tagi ya bokana ka 70%, go apare mmaseke o o bipang nko le molomo fa o le mo teng ga dikago, go tshola sekgala sa katologano se se babalesegileng sa bonnye mmitara o le mongwe, go bula matlhabaphefo go kgontsha kelelo ya mowa le go enitw
trg_text: Cabinet reminded all people in the country to continue taking the necessary preventative measures to safeguard ourselves and others against COVID-19 infection This includes regularly washing our hands with water and soap or using a 70% alcohol-based sanitiser, wearing a mask that covers both the nose and mouth when indoors, keeping a safe social distance of at least one metre, opening windows for ventilation and vaccinatin

src_text: Meento ya COVID-19 e nonofile go thibela bolwetse jo bo masisi, go amogelwa kwa bookelong le los Itshireletse mmogo le ba o ba ratang ka go etela lefelo le le gaufi nao la go tlhabela meento mahala, ga o sa tlhoka le gore o ba itsise gore o tla tla neng
trg_text: COVID-19 vaccinations are effective in preventing serious illness, hospitalisation and even deat Protect yourself and your loved ones by visiting your nearest vaccination site to get vaccinated for free, even without an appointment

src_text: Go Fetogela kwa Kgasong ya Dijithale
trg_text: Migration to digital broadcasting

src_text: Go busediwa morago ga Letlha la go Tima Analoko go tswa go 31 Mopitlwe 2022 go ya go 20 Seetebosigo 2022 go naya puso nako e e lekaneng go konosetsa tiro ya go tsenyetsa malapa a a kwadisitseng ka nako e bile a tshwanetse go a amogela didirisiwa tsa go gasa kgaso ya dijithale (di-STB) pele go timiwa analok
trg_text: The deferment on the Analogue Switch-off Date from 31 March to 30 June 2022 provides sufficient time to government to complete the installation of set-top boxes (STBs) for households that have registered timeously and are entitled to receive them before the analogue switch-of

src_text: Lefapha la Ditlhaeletsano le Dithekenoloji tsa Dijithale le tla netefatsa gore malapa otlhe a le 507 251 a a kwadisitsweng pele ga 31 Diphalane 2021 a golaganngwa pele ga 30 Seetebosigo 2022.
trg_text: The Department of Communications and Digital Technologies will ensure that all the 507 251 households that registered by 31 October 2021 are connected no later than 30 June 2022.

src_text: Malapa a le 260 868 a a kwadisitseng magareng ga 31 Diphalane 2021 le 10 Mopitlwe 2022 a tla tsenyediwa di-STB tsa ona pele ga 30 Lwetse 2022.
trg_text: The 260 868 households that registered between 31 October 2021 and 10 March 2022 will be connected to their STBs by 30 September 2023.

src_text: Kabinete e na le bonnete ba gore go konosediwa ga tiragalo e go tla tshegetsa tiragalo ya go hudugela go dijithale le go rebolwa ga makhubu a lebelo le le kwa godim 4.
trg_text: Cabinet is confident that the completion of this process will support the process of digital migration and the subsequent release of the high frequency spectrum

src_text: Go Lwantsha Bosenyi le Bonweenwee
trg_text: Fighting crime and corruption

src_text: Kabinete e akgotse Mokhomi enara wa Naga wa Sepodise, Mogenerala Sehlahle Fannie Masemola go latela go thapiwa ga gagwe ke Moporesitente Ramaphosa go sa le gal Mogenerala Masemola o na le rekoto e e ntle thata mo tirong ya sepodisi go ralala Aforika Borw
trg_text: Cabinet congratulated the country s new National Commissioner of Police, General Sehlahle Fannie Masemola, following his recent appointment by President Ramaphos General Masemola has an outstanding record of achievements in policing across South Afric

src_text: Kabinete e amogetse ka diatla tsoopedi katlholo e e rebotsweng ke Kgotlatshekelokgolo ya Gauteng e e letlelelang Yuniti ya Kamogo ya Dithoto ya Bothati ba Boset haba ba Bot hot hisi (NPA) go dirisa dithata tsa yona tsa go amoga dithata tsa ba ba nnileng le seabe mo go
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the preservation orders granted to the Asset Forfeiture Unit of the National Prosecuting Authority (NPA) by the Gauteng High Court against those involved in

src_text: thuseng ka matlole
trg_text: financing

src_text: setlamo sa ba ga Gupta sa Tegeta Exploration Resources go reka Moepo wa Malatlha wa Optimum ka diranta di le dibilione di le ka ngwaga wa 2016.
trg_text: the purchase of Optimum Coal Mine for Rbillion in 2016 by the Gupta-owned Tegeta Exploration and Resources compan

src_text: Dikatlholo tse, tse di supang tsela e e nonofileng e bile e golagane ya NPA le Bokaedi ba Dipatlisiso tsa Bosenyi jo bo kwa Setlhoeng ba Tirelo ya Sepodisi sa Aforika Borwa, di romela molaetsa o o bogale ka ga bokgoni bo bo oketsegang ba puso go samagana le maiteko a go Goga Puso ka Nko le go netefatsa gore ba ba amegang ba rwala maikarabelo
trg_text: The rulings, which demonstrate the effective coordinated approach of the NPA and the Directorate for Priority Crime Investigation of the South African Police Service, send a strong message about the growing capacity of government to deal with State Capture and ensure accountability for those involved

src_text: le go tsaya, go ribolola le go busa madi a a utswitswen
trg_text: and to seize, recover and return stolen mone

src_text: Go rwesa ba ba amegang mo bonweenweeng maikarabelo, Kabinete e amogetse katlholo ka Kgotlhatsekelo ya Palm Ridge e e samaganang le dikgetse tsa Bosenyi bo bo Kgethegileng ba Dikgwebo kwa Gauteng e e boneng molato molaodi wa matlole wa mo malobeng wa setlamo sa Eskom ka go tsietsa setlamo se sa motlakase bokana ka dimilione tsa diranta di le 35 jaaka a ne a tsenya ditshupatuelo tsa tsietso tsa go duelela ditirelo tsa go rwalwa ga malatlha mme go sena ditirelo tsa mofuta oo tse di reboletsweng setlamo seno e bile gape e amogetse le dikgato tse di tsewang go busetsa madi ano a a utswitswen
trg_text: In holding those involved in corruption accountable, Cabinet also welcomed the judgement by the Palm Ridge Specialised Commercial Crimes Court in Gauteng against a former Eskom financial controller for defrauding the power utility of R35 million by loading fake invoices for coal transport and the initiatives to recover the stolen monie

src_text: Jaaka tiro e e botlhokwa e e diriwang mo ntweng ya naga ya rona ya go lwantshana le bonweenwee, Kabinete e amogetse karolo ya bone ya Pegelo ya Khomi ene ya Bosiamisi ya Dipatlisiso tsa go Goga Puso ka Nko e e rebotswen Moporesitente Ramaphosa e tla re ka di 30 Seetebosigo 2022 fa a isa pegelo yotlhe kwa Palamenteng a e itsise gape le gore ke dikgato dife tse di tla tsewang go diragatsa dikgato tse khomi ene e akanyang gore di ka tsew 5.
trg_text: the handover of the fourth part of the Judicial Commission of Inquiry into State Capture Repor President Ramaphosa will present to Parliament interventions to implement the commission s recommendations when he submits the full report by 30 June 2022.

src_text: Samiti e e Kgethegileng ya Ditokololo tsa Troika tsa Dinagatlhabololo tsa Borwa jwa Aforika (SADC)
trg_text: Southern African Development Community (SADC) Extraordinary Organ Troika Summit

src_text: Kabinete e amogetse dipoelo tsa Samiti e e Kgethegileng ya Ditokololo tsa Troika ya SADC e e neng e tshwaretswe kwa Pretoria ka Mosupologo, 4 le Labobedi, 5 Moranang 2022.
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the outcomes of SADC Extraordinary Organ Troika Summit held in Pretoria on Monday, 4 and Tuesday, 5 April 2022.

src_text: Aforika Borwa e nnile moamogelabaeng jaaka Monnasetilo wa SADC wa Lephata la Tirisano la Dipolotiki, Tshireletso le Pabaleseg Paka ya naga e, e simolotse ka Phatwe 2021 go fitlha ka Phatwe 2022.
trg_text: South Africa hosted the summit as Chair of the SADC Organ on Politics, Defence and Security Cooperatio The country s tenure runs from August 2021 to August 2022.

src_text: Samiti e e amogetse, gareng ga tse dingwe, pegelo ya seemo ya Morero wa SADC kwa Mozambique (SAMIM).
trg_text: The summit received, among others, the SADC Mission in Mozambique (SAMIM) progress repor The SAMIM was deployed to support Mozambique to combat terrorism and acts of violent extremis 6.

src_text: SAMIM e ne ya romelwa go tshegetsa Mozambique go samagana le ditiragalo tsa bongangelele le tirisodikgoka e e tseneletsen 6.
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed credit rating agency Moody s upgrade of its outlook on South Africa to stable from negative and the decision to affirm South Africa s long-term foreign and local currency debt ratings at

src_text: Ikonomi
trg_text: Economy

src_text: Kabinete e amogetse tshwetso ya setheo sa dielo tsa kerediti sa Moody go tlhatlosa tebo ya yona ya Aforika Borwa go tswa kwa maemong a a kwa tlase ga lefela go ya go maemo a a tlhomameng le tshwetso ya go tlhomamisa le dielo tsa Aforika Borwa tsa pakatelele tsa sekoloto sa ledi la bodit haba le la ka fa nageng mo maemong a
trg_text: Cabinet approved South Africa s UNSDCF 2020-2025 for implementatio The framework provides an accountability partnership between government, the broader society and the UN s country office in South Afric

src_text: Ba2 .
trg_text: Ba2 .

src_text: Tlhatloso e e netefatsa tiro ya puso ya go busetsa tsepamo mo matloleng a puso mo nageng, e leng se se tshegediwang ke kokoanyo ya lekgetho e e fetileng eo e neng e solofetsw
trg_text: The upgrade affirms the work of government to restore sustainability to the country s public finances, which is supported by better-than-expected revenue collectio

src_text: Dipoelo tsa lotseno tsa paka ya Moranang 2021 go fitlha ka Mopitlwe 2022, e supile fa Tirelo ya Lekgetho ya Aforika Borwa e kokoantse diranta tse di fetang ditirilione tse
trg_text: Revenue results for the period April 2021 to March 2022, showed that the South African Revenue Service collected more than Rtrillio It represents a 25 percent improvement over the previous year and a 15 percent increase over the last year prior to the COVID-19 pandemi

src_text: Se se supa koketsego ya diperesente tse 25 fa go bapisiwa le ngwaga o o fetileng, le koketsego ya diperesente tse 15 kwa godimo ga ya ngwaga wa bofelo pele ga leroborobo la COVID-19.
trg_text: South Africa this year celebrates Freedom Month in April with renewed hope for a better tomorrow, having endured two sombre years under the global COVID-19 pandemi The annual Freedom Day will be commemorated on Wednesday, 27 April 2022.

src_text: Puso e dirisa lekgetho leno le le oketsegileng go fokotsa sekoloto gore se se tswe mo taolong le go thusa baagi mo go tlhokagalang ka bonako, go oketsa dikgato tsa go tlholwa ga ditiro ka Lenaneo la Moporesitente la go Thapiwa ga Ba wa, le go tshegetsa lekala la boitekanelo la pus 7.
trg_text: Government is using the additional revenue to accelerate debt stabilisation and address urgent social needs, promote job creation through the Presidential Youth Employment Initiative, and support the public health sector

src_text: Kgwedi ya Kgololesego
trg_text: Freedom Month

src_text: Monongwaga mo kgweding ya Moranang Aforika Borwa e keteka Kgwedi ya Kgololesego mme e tsena mo go yona ka tsholofelo e e nt hwafetseng ya gore la kamoso le tla tlhaba botoka, seno ke ka ntlha ya gore re itshoke sebaka sa dingwaga di le pedi tse di bokete ka fa tlase ga leroborobo la lefatshe lotlhe la COVID-19.
trg_text: Cabinet wished South Africa s Muslim community a blessed Holy Month of Ramada Ramadan is annually marked around the world with prayer, fasting and acts of charit The Muslim community is an integral part of our national diversity and of our national characte

src_text: Letsatsi la Kgololesego la ngwaga le ngwaga le tla ketekiwa ka Laboraro, 27 Moranang 2022.
trg_text: President Ramaphosa will hold a DDM Presidential Imbizo at the Petrus Molemela Sports Complex in Mangaung, Free State on Friday, 8 and Saturday, 9 April 2022.

src_text: Kgwedi ya Kgololesego e gopola le go akgola botlhe ba boineelo ba bona bo dirileng gore re kgone go itumelela ditshwanelo tsa botho le dikgololesego tse di mo teng ga Molaotheo wa rona wa Rephaboleki ya Aforika Borwa wa 1996 o o rolelwang hutshe lefatshe ka bophar
trg_text: Freedom Month commemorates and salutes all those whose sacrifices made it possible for us to enjoy the human rights and freedoms contained in our world-acclaimed Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996.

src_text: Kabinete e ikuetse go Maaforika Borwa otlhe go dira mmogo jaaka re tsweletsa kgaratlho ya rona go fenya COVID-19.
trg_text: Cabinet approved the publication of IK regulations for public commen The IK regulations will give effect to the implementation of the IK Act, 2019 (Act 6 of 2019).

src_text: Rotlhe re tlhoka go dira karolo ya rona go busetsa ikonomi ya rona mannong, ka Leano la Kagose wa le Tsosoloso ya Ikonomi, mme re godise dikgwebo tse dintsi tse di tla kgonang go tlhola ditir 8.
trg_text: We all need to do our part to restore our economy, through the Economic Reconstruction and Recovery Plan, and grow more businesses to be able to create more jobs

src_text: Kgwedi e e Boitshepo ya Ramadan
trg_text: Holy Month of Ramadan

src_text: Kabinete e eleletsa set haba sa Bamoseleme mo Aforika Borwa Kgwedi e e Boitshepo ya Ramada Ngwaga le ngwaga, Ramadan e ketekiwa lefatshe ka bophara ka thapelo, go itima dijo le ditiro tsa go abelana le ba ba tlhokan Set haba sa Bamoseleme ke se sengwe sa dit haba tse di farologaneng tse di botlhokwa tse re nang le tsona mo nageng ya ron
trg_text: The DDM Presidential Imbizo is an important public participation platform as its gives citizens a voice and the President the opportunity to listen to the people and respond to their concern South Africans can follow and participate in discussions on social media under the hashtag #PresidentialImbiz

src_text: Ditshwetso tsa Kabinete1.
trg_text: Issues in the environment1.

src_text: Seralwa sa Leanolegolo la Boset haba la Tlhabololo e e Golaganeng ya Dikgwebopotlana (NISED)
trg_text: Draft National Integrated Small Enterprise Development (NISED) Masterplan

src_text: Kabinete e dumeletse go phasaladiwa ga seralwa sa Leanolegolo la NISED go ngoka ditshwaelo tsa baag Togamaano e e Golaganeng ya Kgwebo le Dikgwebopotlana ya pele e ne ya amogelwa ka 2005.
trg_text: The initial Integrated Strategy for Entrepreneurship and Small Enterprises was adopted in 2005.

src_text: Togamaano e le NISED e e latelang di tsenya tirisong Lekwalo la Mabudusatsela la Puso ka ga Togamaano ya Boset haba ya Tlhabololo le Thotloetso ya Dikgwebopotlana mo Aforika Borwa ya 1995.
trg_text: The strategy and the subsequent NISED give effect to the 1995 White Paper on National Strategy for the Development and Promotion of Small Business in South Afric

src_text: Fa NISED e sena go amogelwa, e tla dira mo boemong jwa Togamaano e e Golaganeng ya Kgwebo le Dikgwebopotlana ya ga jaan E tla tlamela ka letlhomeso la kgolagano ya bannaleseabe botlhe ba botlhokwa ba tikologo mo tlhabololong ya dikgwebopotlan E kaela mekgwa ya momaganyo e e tla kaelang mananeo otlhe a a tshegetsang dikgwebopotlan
trg_text: Once adopted the NISED will replace the current Integrated Strategy for Entrepreneurship and Small Enterprise It will provide a coordination framework for all key ecosystem role players in small enterprise developmen It guides the coordinating mechanism that will guide all programmes that support small enterprise

src_text: Leano le le batla go oketsa go nna le seabe ga dikgwebopotlana mo ikonoming e e tlhomameng, go tlosa dithulaganyotatelano le go rotloetsa bonolo ba go dira kgwebo, segolo go dikgwebopotlan
trg_text: This strategy seeks to increase the participation of small enterprises in the formal economy, eliminate red tape and promote the ease of doing business, particularly for small entrepreneur

src_text: NISED ke ditlamorago tsa ditherisano tse di anameng le mafapha a a maleba mo makaleng a puso a boset haba, porofense le a selegae, kgwebo, badiri, dirutegi le ditheo tse di farologaneng tse di maleb 2.
trg_text: The NISED is the product of a wide consultation with the relevant departments in the national, provincial and local spheres of government, business, labour, academics and various relevant institutions

src_text: Go akarediwa ga Setheo sa Tlamelo ka Matlole go Dikgwebopotlana (SEFA) le Setheo sa Tlhabololo ya Dibanka tsa Koporasi (CBDA) mo Setheong sa Tlhabololo ya Dikgwebopotlana (SEDA)
trg_text: District Development Model (DDM) Presidential Imbizo

src_text: Kabinete e dumeletse paka e e okeditsweng ya dikgwedi tse 20 ya go kopanya ditheo tse pedi ts Kopano e, e ne e beetswe go ka tsena tirisong go tloga ka 1 Moranang 2022.
trg_text: Incorporation of the Small Enterprise Finance Agency (SEFA) and Cooperative Banks Development Agency (CBDA) into the Small Enterprise Development Agency (SEDA) Cabinet approved the 20 months extension period for the merging of the two entities, the SEFA and CBDA, into the SED The merger was initially set to be effective from 1 April 2022.

src_text: Se e nnile morago ga gore Kabinete e dumelele go kopanngwa go go netefatsa gore puso e tlamela ka setheo se le sengwe se se tla tshegetsang tiro ya yona ya go tshegetsa dikgwebo tse dinnye le tse di magareng gammogo le dikoporas
trg_text: This was after Cabinet approved the mergers to ensure government provides a single entity that will support its work in supporting small to medium enterprises and cooperative The approved extension will enable the Department of Small Business Development to finalise the legislative review to provide a proper legislated and policy environment that allows the formation of the single entity

src_text: Katoloso e e dumeletsweng e, e tla kgontsha Lefapha la Tlhabololo ya Dikgwebopotlana go konosetsa tshekatsheko ya melao go tlamela ka tikologo e e maleba ya melao le dipholisi e e letlang go bopiwa ga setheo se le sengwe
trg_text: SED A single and well-resourced entity will provide a more streamlined support to small to medium enterprises and cooperative Cabinet also approved the appointment of the interim Boards of Directors for the SEFA and SEDA

src_text: SED Setheo se le sengwe se se nang le metswedithuso e e lekaneng se tla tlamela ka tshegetso e e tlhomameng sentle go tshegetsa dikgwebo tse dinnye le tse di magareng ga mmogo le dikoporas Kabinete e amogetse gape le go thapiwa ga Bakaedi ba Diboto tsa nakwana tsa SEFA le SED 3.
trg_text: pillars to cover (1) inclusive , justice and sustainable growth; (2) human capital and social transformation; (3) effective, efficient and transformative governance; and (4) climate resilience and sustainably managed natural resource

src_text: Melawana Tebang le Tshireletso, Thotloetso, Tlhabololo le Taolo ya Kitso ya Tlhago (IK)
trg_text: Regulations relating to the Protection, Promotion, Development and Management of Indigenous Knowledge (IK regulations)

src_text: Kabinete e dumeletse go phasaladiwa ga melawana ya IK go ngoka ditshwaelo tsa baag Melawana ya IK e tla thusa go tsenya tirisong Molao wa IK, 2019 (Molao 6 wa 2019).
trg_text: The Act provides for the protection, promotion, development and management of indigenous knowledg It provides for the establishment of national IK systems; management of rights of IK of communitie It also provides for the establishment of an advisory panel; recognition of prior learnings; facilitation and coordination of I

src_text: Molao o o tlamela ka tshireletso, thotloetso, tlhabololo le taolo ya kitso ya tlhag O tlamela ka go tlhongwa ga dithulaganyo tsa boset haba tsa IK; taolo ya IK tsa set hab O tlamela gape le ka go tlhongwa ga setlhopha sa bogakolodi; temogo ya dithuto tsa pele; tsamaiso le momaganyo ya I
trg_text: The proposed regulations deal with, amongst others, the setting up of the Advisory Panel; accreditation processes; registration of competencies of IK practitioners; how to access or use IK and the safekeeping of registers of I The regulations also provide for dispute-resolution mechanism

src_text: Melawana e e tshitshinngwang e tla samagana le, gareng ga tse dingwe, go tlhongwa ga Setlhopha sa Bogakolodi; ditsamaiso tsa tumelelo; kwadiso ya bokgoni ba badiri ba IK; tsela ya go fitlhelela kgotsa go dirisa IK le go boloka direjisetara tsa I Melawana e e tlamela gape ka ditsela tsa tharabololo ya dikgotlan

src_text: Letlhomeso la Dit habakopano la Tlhabololo e e Tswelelang e bile e Kopanetswe (UNSDCF) la 2020-2025
trg_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Cooperation Framework (UNSDCF) 2020-2025

src_text: Kabinete e dumeletse go tsenngwa tirisong ga UNSDCF 2020-2025 la Aforika Borw Letlhomeso le le tlamela ka semphato sa maikarabelo fa gare ga puso, set haba ka kakaretso le kantoro ya UN ya naga mo Aforika Borw
trg_text: Vision 2030 and the Medium Term Strategic Framework, and also with the UN Sustainable Development Goals driven through the UN country s office in South Afric The implementation will be done through a joint resource mobilisation strategy

src_text: UNSDCF e tlhagisa dipilara tse nne tsa botlhokwa tse di akaretsang (1) kgolo e e akaretsang, ya bosiamisi e bile e tswelela; (2) tlhabololo ya badiri le ya loago; (3) puso e e nonofileng, e e bokgoni e bile e tlisa diphetogo; le (4) tsepamo ya tlelaemete le dikumo tsa tlhago tse di laolwang ka tshwanel
trg_text: To give effect to the assumption of responsibility, National Cabinet Representatives (NCR) will shortly be deployed to both municipalitie The Minister of Finance will delegate powers to the NCR and will also be supported by a multidisciplinary team of expert No decision has yet been taken to dissolve the municipal council in terms of Section 139(5)(b) of the Constitutio

src_text: Dipilara tse tsa botlhokwa di golagane le Leanotlhabololo la Boset haba la Naga: Ponelopele ya 2030 le Letlhomeso la Togamaano la Pakagare, gammogo le Maikaelelo a Kgolo e e Tswelelang a UN a a tsamaisiwang ke kantoro ya naga ya UN mo Aforika Borw Tsenyotirisong e tla diragadiwa ka mokgwa wa tiriso ya tlhakanelo ya metswedithus 5.
trg_text: The invocation of a national intervention in terms of Section 139(7) of the Constitution implies that in both municipalities, national government will now act in the stead of the Provincial Executiv This type of intervention is mandatory and follows the same procedure as Section 139(5) of the Constitution, except that national government will now directly assume responsibility for these intervention

src_text: Tsereganyo ya boset haba kwa mmasepaleng wa Toropokgolo ya Mangaung le Mmasepala wa Selegae wa Enoch Mgijima
trg_text: National intervention in the Mangaung Metropolitan and Enoch Mgijima Local municipalities

src_text: Kabinete e dumeletse tsereganyo e go ya ka Karolo 139(7) ya Molaotheo wa Rephaboleki ya Aforika Borwa wa 1996, e buisiwa mmogo le Karolo 150 ya Molao wa Tsamaiso ya Matlole a Bommasepala, 2003 (Molao 56 wa 2003), kwa mmasepaleng wa Toropokgolo ya Mangaung le Mmasepala wa Selegae wa Enoch Mgijim Bommasepala ka bobedi ba ntse ba retelelwa mo mererong ya matlole le thebolelo ya ditirelo mo nakong e telel
trg_text: The national intervention will take effect upon formal gazetting in the Government Gazette, however, the current Section 139(5) intervention will remain in effect until this dat The Section 139(1) intervention into the Enoch Mgijima Local Municipality will also be replaced by a Section 139 (5) (a) and (c) intervention, which will also cover the failure of the municipality to fulfil its executive obligation The Minister in The Presidency, Mr Mondli

src_text: Khuduthamaga ya Porofense ya Foreisetata e beile Mmasepala wa Toropokgolo ya Mangaung ka fa tlase ga ditsereganyo tsa pateletso go ya ka Karolo 139(5) (a) le (c) ya Molaotheo ka Sedimonthole 2019.
trg_text: The Free State Provincial Executive placed the Mangaung Metropolitan Municipality under a mandatory intervention in terms of Section 139(5) (a) and (c) of the Constitution in December 2019.

src_text: Morago ga moo, leano la tsosoloso ya matlole la pateletso le ne la tsenngwa tirisong ka 2020.
trg_text: A mandatory financial recovery plan was subsequently imposed on the municipality in 2020.

src_text: Morago ga go retelelwa mo nakong e e fetang dingwaga tse pedi go tsenya tirisong ditsereganyo tsa leano la tsosoloso ya matlole, Toropokgolo e ga jaana e beilwe ka fa tlase ga tsereganyo ya boset haba go ya ka Karolo 139(7) ya Molaothe
trg_text: After failing for more than two years to implement the financial recovery plan during the provincial intervention, the Metro has now been placed under a national intervention in terms of Section 139(7) of the Constitutio

src_text: Mmasepala wa Selegae wa Enoch Mgijima le ona o ne wa bewa ka fa tlase ga tsereganyo ya pateletso ke Khuduthamaga ya Porofense ya Kapa Botlhaba go ya ka Karolo 139(5) (a) ya Molaotheo ka 2018.
trg_text: The Enoch Mgijima Local Municipality was also placed under mandatory intervention by the Eastern Cape Provincial Executive in terms of Section 139(5) (a) of the Constitution in 2018.

src_text: Le fa go le jalo, morago ga gore mmasepala o o retelelwe ke go nna le tswelopele mo go tokafatseng tiragatso ya ona ya matlole le thebolelo ya ditirelo, Kabinete e ne ya swetsa go o baya ka fa tlase ga tsereganyo ya boset hab
